GULFPORT , Mississippi -- A convicted felon was arrested on a weapons charge after he shot a dog in his Gulfport yard and an off - duty Jackson County Sheriff 's Deputy reported him to Gulfport police .

RelatedSentence: GULFPORT , Mississippi -- A convicted felon was arrested on a weapons charge after he shot a dog in his Gulfport yard and an off - duty Jackson County Sheriff 's Deputy reported him to Gulfport police .
According to Gulfport Police Chief Leonard Papania , police responded to a report of shots fired in the 500 block of Harvey Avenue Friday afternoon .
Upon arrival , officers spoke with the off - duty deputy , who advised that 42 - year - old Christopher George Ivey had shot a dog and later placed a .22 caliber rifle in his residence .

Upon arrival , officers spoke with the off - duty deputy , who advised that 42 - year - old Christopher George Ivey had shot a dog and later placed a .22 caliber rifle in his residence .
After further investigation , it was learned Ivey was a convicted felon and he was arrested for Possession of a Weapon by a Felon .
Ivey is being held in the Harrison County Adult Detention Center under a $ 15,000 bond set by Justice Court Judge Louise D. Ladner .
